user:
API Knowledge:
kotlin.collections.listOf() in Kotlin is used to create an immutable list of elements.
kotlin.collections.mutableListOf() in Kotlin is used to create a mutable list of elements, allowing for modification.
The available scenarios of kotlin.collections.listOf: need to create a list of elements that won't change.
The unavailable scenarios of kotlin.collections.mutableListOf: when you don't need to modify the list after creation. If your list is set at creation and does not require changes, using listOf would be more appropriate as it is immutable and can offer better performance and safety guarantees.
Claim: kotlin.collections.listOf() and kotlin.collections.mutableListOf() have similar usage, and kotlin.collections.listOf() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of kotlin.collections.mutableListOf().

API Knowledge:
kotlin.text.replace() in Kotlin is used to replace all occurrences of a substring in the string with a new value.
kotlin.text.replaceFirst() in Kotlin is used to replace the first occurrence of a substring in the string with a new value.
The available scenarios of kotlin.text.replace: need to replace all occurrences of a substring in a string.
The unavailable scenarios of kotlin.text.replaceFirst: need to replace more than the first occurrence of a substring in a string.
Claim: kotlin.text.replace() and kotlin.text.replaceFirst() have similar usage, and kotlin.text.replace() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of kotlin.text.replaceFirst().

API Knowledge:
kotlin.system.measureTimeMillis() in Kotlin is used to measure the time taken to execute a block of code, returning the time in milliseconds.
kotlin.system.exitProcess() in Kotlin is used to terminate the current process and return a status code to the calling process.
The available scenarios of kotlin.system.measureTimeMillis: when you want to measure the execution time of specific code segments for performance analysis or optimization.
The unavailable scenarios of kotlin.system.exitProcess: for measuring execution time or performance analysis. This function is specifically for terminating the process and does not relate to performance measurement.
Claim: kotlin.system.measureTimeMillis() and kotlin.system.exitProcess() have similar usage, and kotlin.system.measureTimeMillis() can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of kotlin.system.exitProcess().

API Knowledge:
kotlin.collections.HashMap() in Kotlin is used to create a hash-based map.
kotlin.collections.LinkedHashMap() in Kotlin is used to create a hash-based map that maintains the insertion order.
The available scenarios of kotlin.collections.HashMap: need to create a map without concern for the order of entries.
The unavailable scenarios of kotlin.collections.LinkedHashMap: need a map that does not maintain insertion order.
Claim: kotlin.collections.HashMap and kotlin.collections.LinkedHashMap have similar usage, and kotlin.collections.HashMap can be used in the above unavailable scenarios of kotlin.collections.LinkedHashMap.
